result.execSummary:
All charges against Eugene E Ward in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Eugene E Ward is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Eugene E Ward in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Case is set for Jury Trial. Defense ready to proceed. State's essential witness failed to appear.  Defense motion to Dismiss is GRANTED by the Court.

State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Closing arguments by state and defense.
Court DENIED Defense motion for supression. Case adjourned for jury trial Branch 47.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Eugene E Ward not in court.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
